long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,el,en,en_AU,en_GB,e:
QWORUM -- THE SERVICE WEB

Qworum is a variant of the World Wide Web that is especially suitable for applications. Qworum brings advanced new capabilities to web browsers that applications can leverage. Most websites that provide applications can benefit from using Qworum.

If a web application asks you to install Qworum, you can safely do so. This extension:
1. will only be activated on a select few websites.
2. respects your privacy; your data does not leave your browser.

Follow us on ùïè: @QworumNet.

LATEST RELEASE NOTES
1.5.0:
Conform to the latest Qworum specification.

1.4.1:
Fixes a software-dependency-related bug. Applications that use XML for delivering Qworum scripts to browsers are advised to move to version 1.6.7 of the Qworum JavaScript library.

1.3.4:
Web applications can now use a lighter version of the JS library that offers the same capabilities.

Improved the code base without changing the user experience:
* Refactored the code base in order to make it more modular.
* Improvements around semantic data, now represented as RDF datasets.
* The content script is lighter, as it no longer parses Qworum scripts.
* Removed console.* printouts.

1.3.3:
Update the list of websites that are part of Qworum's Service Web.

1.3.2:
Conform to the latest Qworum specification.

‚àé
long.de,tr:
WHAT TO DO IF A WEBSITE ASKS YOU TO INSTALL QWORUM:

Simply install Qworum.

Some websites will only work correctly if the Qworum browser extension is installed on your browser. If a website asks you to install Qworum, please do so. This extension:

1. will only be activated on a select few websites, and when it is running its use of your computer's resources will be minimal.

2. respects your privacy. Qworum only has access to data that websites send it, and this data is deleted when you close the website's tab. Your data does not leave your computer.

QWORUM IS THE SERVICE WEB THAT ENABLES  DISTRIBUTED WEB APPLICATIONS:

Qworum is a new browser capability that websites can use. It is:

1. a module system for Web applications, where modules may be located anywhere on the Web.
2. a distributed Web application technology.
3. a platform for interactive microservices; these are microservices that bring their own micro-frontends.
4. the Service Web that complements the HTML-based Document Web and the RDF-based Semantic Web.
5, an upgrade to the World Wide Web for improved application support.
an advanced Web browser feature that websites can use.

Qworum defines:

1. a new top-level Web format called the Qworum script. These contain executable code rather than content as HTML does. Web browsers can receive Qworum scripts from Web servers in an XML document. Web pages can also generate Qworum scripts using JavaScript.
2. an interpreter for Qworum scripts. This client-side software can be implemented by Web browsers natively or as a browser extension.
3. a new client-side storage for storing the execution state of each browser tab. This storage can use IndexedDB behind the scenes.

Qworum is suitable for both:

1. Jamstack frontends that are made up of static files, and
2. the more legacy Web frontends that are dynamically generated on the server for each user.

Follow us on Twitter: @QworumNet.
